Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: NOT-Stuck-in-India
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hotel 1929 for our very quick 18-hour layover. I chose this hotel due to the reviews on TripAdvisor -- we weren't disappointed! We arrived around 2:AM in the morning and were greeted nicely upon arrival by the front desk. He gave us a great recommendation on a hawker stall down the street to grab a bite since we were starving! We were already familiar with the area, and can say that this hotel is in a GREAT location. The decor is very modern and simple, which we really liked. The room was TINY, but comfortable and had a mini-fridge with complimentary soda. The shower doubled as the toilet stall -- but having lived in Asia, that's nothing abnormal. The bed was average -- it was little noisy due to a bar or restaurant that was right across of the hotel, but nothing that kept us up. They gave us late check-out as we had arrived so late in the reservation -- very helpful as we wanted to explore for a while and didn't have anywhere to take our luggage. The room was approx. $187 SGD for the night. Yes, a little high for how tiny the room was, but as it was a boutique hotel and the location was good, I'd happily stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: HTEvansAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a fantastic location, minutes away from China town and minutes away by foot to the nearest MRT in Outram Park. It may seem basic and small from outside, I thought this hotel catered for my every needs. Do not expect the same as a five star hotel, this is a three star but they have thought of everything. Comfortable room, good bed, sink, little table, lamp, stationaries, soap, alarm clock. in the bath room, no bath tub but shower next to toilet, nice towel, towelette, shampoo, bath gel. Yes, basic - but with it's prime shopping location, you do not really want to spend any time - longer than necessary coup up inside the hotel! I was there on a Friday and the hotel had some renovations undertaken so it was noisy. On arrival, I was made immediately aware by the hotel staff who apologies profusely and reassured me that the noise would be over by 6 pm. They were true to their word. The lobby staff were very helpful (more so than any 3-star hotel) that i would expect! Before I left, i was given a bottle of water and some biscuits to munch on - in case i was hungry whilst waiting for my taxi. one of the staff member even wished me "happy birthday" in advance as they noted that it was in the coming week! I will definitely return again if I ever needed to stop over at Singapore. Well done hotel 1929.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Koeln_04
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at 1929 during our first trip to Singapore based on the tripadvisor reviews. We booked a deluxe room: in the case of this hotel "deluxe" still means extremely small with just a tiny window directly under the roof. Therefore, there was little noise despite the room faced to the front street, but also no means of looking outside. We found this a little disappointing at first. However, the room was very nicely furnished and offered everything we needed. After all, we didn't spend much time inside anyways. Breakfast was sufficient but not special, the staff was extremely nice, the hotel is located in an area that has lots of restaurants and nightlife to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Small is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the furniture style in the lobby, and the location in Chinatown. I had not realized that the rooms were, umm....tiny? So small, in fact, that I took a funny video of me watching TV, sitting ON my bed, and washing my hands in the sink....all at the same time. BUT....if you don't mind the closeness (and I DO NOT...but of course I was a solo traveler)....it has a great rooftop deck and the balconies over the street are really a cool place to people watch. The food in the restaurant/lobby can probably be skipped. Too pricey for what you get. Overall....I say it's a pretty good place.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: alpha333
Reviews.Content: Not cheap (although not expensive for S'pore) and pretty awful. Wouldn't recommend - better to pay extra $50-70/night and have a pleasant stay in this great city than suffer through this. The smallest rooms I've ever seen, extremely cramped, and noisy as well. I'd rate it as a 2 star hotel based on the room. Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever!! Shocking & Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Gracieeeeee
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 had been an extremely disappointing experience for my boyfriend and myself: - Hotel Website - the hotel website is misleading, not to mention that none of the features of the (mutli-functional) mini-size washroom/shower was highlighted... all the pictures featured on the webiste had used wide angles which gave an impression that the room is in relatively "liveable" size, in fact... when my bf and myself entered the room, one had to stay in bed in order to allow another person to walk to the washroom. Over Priced - we had many experiences in staying at boutique hotels, and had been enjoying of paying a bit more but enjoying the modern design of the hotel, but this time having paid at a price of 4 star price but you are given a "cage" room, and the room has no design at all Room Size - is definitely misleading, as the room is worse than super small, when we checked in, the reception staff told us maybe we should keep some luggage at the reception, since he told us the room is "quite small", and he meant it, it's not quite small but unacceptable. There was not even a closet in the room, but only 3 hangers on the wall... Shower & toilet - I was shocked when I realized that the shower and the toilet are in fact within the same small "area" which the shower is installed on top of the toilet seat. How come this picture was never shown on their website, nor had they mentioned anything at all? Air Ventilation - the Room is filled with stingy small, and it's very stuffy, even the corridor air is not freshing at all... it didn't give you a very welcoming feeling. Breakfast - While I must acknowledged the fact that the staff serving breakfast is very nice, they need to do a lot towards cleanliness. The fork and knifes given were dirty, filled with food stains, and the plates next to the buffet, had also food stains underneath the plate I picked. How gross can it be especially it's a morning breakfast and you touched all these "dirty" cutleries!! Noise - Literally there is no difference than living in on the ground floor, as you can perfectly understand when the truck comes over to pick up the "trash" and also the construction workers starts working at 7 am in the morning. There is no quality of sleep at all..... Bed - the room was so small that the bed was pushed to the window side, and one who sleep against the wall/window side, will kept on hitting the curtain which you will be awaken everytime you moved your body... Jacuzzi - Our room is facing directly to the outdoor Jacuzzi, but "surprisingly" without even being advised when we booked the hotel via the website, nor upon our check in, that the Jacuzzi was under maintenance. I did consider to try also the same chain "New Majestic" nor "Wonderluxe" but having read all the reviews, in the future, I will stay on the safe side to avoid these hotels. One advice to all the travellers, be sure to read the reviews by other travellers of the hotel you plan to stay, this time, we didn't have time and the pictures looks awesome of Hotel 1929, but we made a HUGE Mistake!!! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: stretford79
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Singapore in 10 years. Booked the 1929 on a friends recommendation. Yes the rooms are small but I like the functionality of the room. Staff friendly and great with directions etc.The only down side to my stay was the kitchen exhaust fan outside my room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing lack of advertised facilities”
Reviews.Author: Pen M
Reviews.Content: "Deluxe" room size is adequate for Singapore, but there is extremely limited storage and the room had only 3 clothes hangers for 2 people to share, for 4 nights this is just not enough. The double bed was pushed into a corner making it awkward for one of us to get into bed. Shower cubicle made good use of the space, but the water stayed warm for very limited time, meaning one of had to wait for it to get hot again. One of the major reasons we chose to book this hotel was the advertised roof garden/terrace with hot tub - thinking it would be a good place to relax at the end of a hard days sightseeing! We didn't get the opportunity to test this - it was unavailable, something we were not told until we asked how to get to it. As we booked and paid for this stay several months in advance we were very disappointed not to be advised prior to our arrival that this facility had been withdrawn. Surely we should have been given the opportunity to cancel our booking or been offered alternative accommodation that provided the outside space this hotel continues to erroneously advertise. Cooked breakfast was ok but sameish, orange "juice" is concentrate mixed with water and there was a very limited selection of cereal, but the coffee is good. Bed linen of good quality, bedroom clean, mini-fridge topped up with water on a daily basis. Room was noisy at times, but it is in Chinatown so it comes with the territory to a certain extent, however, cleaning staff do clattering around from 7ish.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room - Hotel 1929, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TSmith48
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the end of February 2012, and unfortunately were assigned an extremely tiny room at the front of the hotel. The queen-sized bed was pushed up against the wall so that one person had to climb onto the bed before the 2nd person could get into bed. The room was extremely noisy as well. Anyone booking into this hotel would be well-advised to check the room size at the time of booking, and also to request a room that does NOT face Keong Saik Road. The room was very cute and the use of space was delightful. But it would have been better suited to a solo traveler. On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the included breakfast was very good, and the hotel is situated very conveniently for easy exploration of the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jimboe89
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small, but what a great place to stay. The rooms are well appointed and functional. The breakfast is very tasty and the staff provide good service. Hotel1929 is in a great location for catching the metro and exploring the rest of Singapore. Will be back in the future, much better than a bland corporate chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: LionelDubai
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really small, which makes it quite hard to be 2 in the room. Location is really great which makes it a perfect hotel for single travellers wanted to spend time visiting Singapore. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is included but cousl be much better.1 sausage and fried eggs, is a bit small choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RIN0B
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Chinatown, rooms a little small but service and cleanliness exceptional. Very comfortable, better than staying in a major chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vivace49
Reviews.Content: I had done my research so having read the many complaints on trip advisor was prepared for a tiny cramped room. Also having arrived from the E&O in Penang was expecting disappointment. But not at all! Our stay of 7 nights here was a delight from beginning to end. The room was ingenious in the use of space and we never felt cramped. The location is excellent and we were privileged to watch both the Chinese celebrations and the Thaipusam festival from the comfort of our room. The breakfast was good and the staff excellent. They all showed great concern that my husband, who has health problems, was coping and several of them came to wish us well when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: virtuousreview
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 is close to train stations and an easy walk to restaurants in Chinatown. The rooms are quite small but they are clean and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying my stay at Hotel 1929”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: Superior Single room on 3rd Floor. 3 night stay. Breakfast, WIFI Internet and bottled water/soft drinks in the fridge are complimentary. I am not finding the room small at all as other reviews seem to suggest. I find it very comfortable and adequate space for a person travelling on their own. The bed is slightly raised to allow suitcase to be put underneath. The bed is very comfortable and a wide king single size. Great blockout blinds on both windows so I slept very well - even sleeping in I was so comfortable!! The bathroom is a wet room with lovely green and white tiles. I preferred using the hand-held shower attachment rather than the ceiling rain shower. Nice toiletries and very large towel. I like the basin and mirror near the bed, though the table it sits on has sharp corners and is very close to the edge of the bed. No wardrobe, but I like the wall hanging for clothes near the bed. I do wish there was a little shelf beside the bedhead to put a cup of tea on. All staff are very friendly. Check-in time of 3pm is rather late compared to other hotels, though my bags were stored while I went out sightseeing and when I returned to check-in my bags had been placed in my room. Breakfast in Ember Restaurant near reception was nice. The room is rather dark - a bit difficult to see in that low light at 7.30am. Great coffee - had 3 cups, choice of cooked eggs, bacon, sausage, beans and potato. Plus choice of 2 cereals, toast, croissants, jams and Kaya, tropical fruits, juice. I like the area - very interesting to wander around the nearby streets and to hear the soft sound of bells from the nearby temple. I am very happy with Hotel 1929 and have 1 more night left of my stay. Looking forward to another great sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Room was so SMALL”
Reviews.Author: derrick69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently. The room that was allocated to us was so small that we had no place to place the luggage but to place it below the bed. There were hardly any room for the 2 of us to move around the room. To create more walking space, each time one of us need to move around, the other had to crawl onto the bed. The toilet was very small. There was hardly any room for 1 person to take a shower. In addition, the rain shower outlet is directly above the toilet seat. So, if you need to use the toilet, you might get a few drips of water from the rain shower. The air has a masky smell. It was poorly ventilated. With the price that we paid for, it was totally not worth going to this hotel. There are far better hotel than this. It was really an experience we wish to forget.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Very Clean (a bit loud)”
Reviews.Author: Anne R
Reviews.Content: Small efficient room but very clean. Friendly Staff. Free in room Wifi. My only criticism is that the hallways are un-carpeted so you hear everything outside your room ie late night returners and early morning flight people dragging there belongs, footfalls. I am not too picky and I bring earplugs while traveling but if you are sound sensitive I would probably choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel... Nice Small Rooms & in China Town”
Reviews.Author: Hari22nair
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but u feel good staying in alone... the bathrooms are full glass doors and somewhere u feel the style and the class (being in a small one) Simple & Sober Singaporean Staff...! This hotel in on the Keong Saik Road, which was earlier called the China Town; famous old red street area in Singapore. Now also taxi drivers know China town than keong saik :-) Visiting Singpaore alone; grab this hotel.. its nearby to most of the area.

Reviews.Title: “small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: banbh
Reviews.Content: The room is small, you will need to push your suitcase under the bed to give you more space. The shower is in the same frosted-glass enclosure as the toilet so things get wet. There is a sink outside the cubicle. It can get a little noisy outside due to a nightclub (it was a Friday night) but nothing some earplugs won't solve. What you will get that makes Hotel 1929 worthwhile is character, good service, and an excellent location. Close to the MRT, a short walk to Chinatown (2mins) and all that Food Street has to offer. The exterior of the hotel is beautiful and the black & white photos lining the halls are very interesting. Complimentary water & softdrinks are provided in a small fridge as well as Ipod port, wifi & TV. Breakfast was included, and was ok. We only stayed one night, so the small room wasn't an issue but for a long stay it may not be ideal, but it's great if you want to be near Chinatown and don't need a spacious room to lounge around in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little package.”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon4Infinity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the F1 weekend for a realistic price and walked to the MRT (Chinatown station) to get to the F1 track and shopping centres ~$3AUD a day. Yes the rooms are small/tiny, so if you're a large human or are a little claustrophobic this isn't your best bet, don't sook later. We loved the thought of the 'conservations shop house' - and even more so the photographs in the hallways of people and family’s that used to live there (nice touch). Yes, breakfast wasn't the ... hotel chain huge buffet - more so something you may cook yourself at home. Dinner was a stroll away to Chinatown - try: Erich Wuerstelstand (Austrian sausages) YUM! This is the first boutique hotel we have stayed in and loved the personalised service and assistance from failure faces daily, we will check out 1929 bigger sister New Majestic Hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: DumbaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in December 2011. Rooms are immaculate and staff are friendly and helpful. Convenient location near bars and restaurants and Chinatown MRT.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: OntheRoadAgain_VS
Reviews.Content: Although the room is small, it was very clean and comfortable. We had no problem with room size for 2 people and found it had everything we needed. The furnishings are lovely and the bed was very comfortable. The room design really helps you appreciate what can be done in a small space and we were impressed with what they have achieved. The staff are friendly and helpful, with one member of staff going out of their way to accommodate our change in travel plans. We loved the location as it was only a short walk to Chinatown markets and eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but overall a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cs6345
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Nov-11 and chose to return for another night in Dec-11. The rooms were very small. On our first visit, the room we had was only just big enough to take a double bed - there was approx 50cm around the side and bottom of the bed, so there was not really adequate space for luggage. On our second stay, the room was considerably larger - ask for a corner room to get the space. The bed was comfortable and the air-con was relatively quiet. The 'bathroom' was more a shower cubicle with a toilet inside. The glass doors were a bit odd and offered little privacy. The hot water ran out after approx 5mins, which wasn't long enough for 2 people to shower in. However, it did reheat within approx 15mins so it was not a huge problem. There was free, fast WiFi throughout the hotel. Everything was very clean, in the room and throughout the hotel. Breakfast was OK with a good selection of cereals, croissants, toast, a cooked breakfast and fresh fruit. The location is good, being close (approx 5mins walk) to Outram Park MRT (on the green and purple lines) and a short walk to Chinatown. A taxi to the airport at 5am only costed $25. There is a temple opposite the hotel, which rings bells for approx 20mins from 07.30 each morning, so it was quite noisy in the mornings. The hotel is good value for money. The location and quality of the rooms more than makes up for the small size.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience, and priced for that”
Reviews.Author: Eric M
Reviews.Content: If you want to take someone to a very unique and different hotel, away from the big chains and expansive rooms, this is the place. Architecturally the rooms are impressive. They are also small. You are paying for the experience, not the space. And the glass enclosed bathroom, while impressive for what it was, didn't give my wife the privacy she would have preferred. I'm glad we stayed here once, but don't need to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Icarus5
Reviews.Content: We had layovers in Singapore before and after our Bali trip, so what we were after was budget accommodations close to everything. I have to say that this was the smallest hotel room that I've ever stayed in. I was sharing the room with my partner, and it was quite awkward and tight at times. The toilet is _in_ the glassed-off shower area which opens directly onto the room/bed. I would not recommend this room to couples who are not extremely intimate as there really is no privacy whatsoever. The room smelled a bit musty/moldy at all times, probably as a result of the A/C not being on when the room is not occupied; as a result, the bathroom/shower area never has a chance of completely drying out. There are clubs and restaurants directly outside your windows, so do not expect a quiet hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but friendly”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGeezerUk
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small but I expected that having read other reviews - imagine a square with a corner cut off that forms the shower & toilet (the hand basin is in the room) so you can use the toilet & shower at the same time. If you travel light then fine as there are no wardrobes to hang clothes. The TV was fine and the radio has an iPod dock plus a mini fridge with complimentary water & cola that was restocked every day and free WIFI. The doors do let noise in and some people can't seem to close a door without it slamming but that is not the hotels fault. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The metro is quite close (Outram Park) and Chinatown is walking distance. You do hear the local temple ring a bell at 7.30am every morning but we used that as an alarm clock. All in all a satisfactory hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: PeonyThailand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night transiting through to another city. Therefore, I have to say that I didn’t get to spend a lot of time in the hotel and did not know anything much about the location apart from that it is in China Town. The hotel is nicely decorated and has its unique charms of being a modern hotel with retro feelings. Its premise is clean and new. The staff were efficient. As for the room, this has got to be the smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed at. I stayed in one of their superior single rooms and felt quite claustrophobic. The room is tiny but functional and clean. The hotel did take care of all the details. But considering the room rate, which was not cheap, I don’t think it’s good value for money at all. I also was struggling with the shower, which was combined with the toilet. The shower and the toilet are put together in a kind-of shower cubicle that made up the entire bathroom, and the sink is outside, next to the bed. While I think this hotel is really not for me, my colleague who stayed here so many times and even for one extended stay seems to really love it (hence her recommendation for us to stay here this time.).

Reviews.Title: “Nice deco, pleasant staff, lousy sleep”
Reviews.Author: wennyow
Reviews.Content: Made an impromptu decision to stay in Hotel 1929 last saturday. Deco from the lobby to the lift to the room is nice with a touch of traveling back into history kind of feel. Room is small but well equiped with a mini fridge (only able to take 4 bottles of water and no more), tv, queen sized bed and a standing bath. Perhaps it was the location and facing of the room, but we did not get a good night sleep at all. There was loud music blasting from the nearby pub till past midnight, someone blasting music from we don't know where at 4pm, constant vehicle noises. ARGH! We ended up being more tired the next day. Breakfast was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Reserve a room in Chinatown and you will end up in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: On Nov 14, I reserved a terrace suite room via the hotel website. The reservation was confirmed and guaranteed with credit card; and I also obtained the confirmation on that day. But on the very next day when I arrived at the hotel, the hotel staff told me that the suite rooms are already fully booked and transferred me to its sister hotel, Wanderlust in Little India. I was so surprised when I saw the room at Wanderlust hotel, it was extremely dark with almost no lighting yet with so many kinky dolls. Ooh very terrible!! I couldnt get a sleep that night. And by the way, that little strange dark room cost me SGD 317 (same rate with Hotel 1929 Terrace Suite Room) !! To make things worse, when I wrote a complaint letter to the hotel later, they replied me that they only received my booking on Nov 15. Very ridiculous! I got the booking confirmation on Nov 14 and I do have the evidence. So beware to make reservation on Hotel 1929! You might end up in Little India!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and nice”
Reviews.Author: Jessica097
Reviews.Content: Love the shophouses in Singapore, that's why I decided to stay in Hotel 1929 instead of some chain hotels elsewhere. I had a single room, room 306, with a balcony! but the door can't be opened unless you are prepared to move the bed a fair bit...that's how small the room is. Of course I read all the reviews and was well aware of the size and the wet room. If it doesn't bother you, then this is a great choice in Singapore. Bed is comfy, free drinks is a nice touch as well. Close to MRT (Chinatown and Outram Park). The only thing I don't like is the late night noise from bars outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, quirky hotel with very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustfulJL
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 9 nights recently - 7 nights, then another 2 nights after a trip-within-a-trip to Bangkok. The hotel was happy for store one of our suitcases for us while we were away and when we returned, it was already in the room to which we were assigned. The size of the rooms has already been well commented on by others. If you can see past this, you will probably enjoy this fun, quirky hotel with very nice staff. (If you plan to have lots of late nights and intend to have undisturbed lie-ins, do ask for a room that is not near the store/cleaners' room, which can become a hive of noisy activity quite early in the morning.) The location is great too - in a very interesting and vibrant part of Singapore, with easy access to the MRT. Overall, I liked Hotel 1929 a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonnhyu
Reviews.Content: Stayed early October for two days and that was enough. The room was too even for a couple. I understood the idea of boutique hotel, something different and trendy and what I found very interesting about this hotel the manipulation of given space. The breakfast is nothing special, continental and eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Lavy81
Reviews.Content: As many have mentioned, the Single rooms are really small. I brought a laptop and there was literally no place for me to put the laptop - I had to move several things about to make space. Having said that, after considering many many other choices, this is still good value for what you get. The breakfast was not just "yoghurt, coffee and croissant" like 1 reviewer mentioned before, but also consisted of eggs, sausages, bacon, baked beans etc. It is at a good location in Chinatown and close to the Chinatown complex food court and Temple Street. Much preferable than staying in Orchard where meals can be astronomical.The staff was friendly and helpful. Dont expect any "real" communal areas though, the jacuzzi area and the seating area was small. I will be back again here when I am in Singapore again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in Singapores China Town”
Reviews.Author: masgendut
Reviews.Content: The service at this property is excellent. The staff are attentive and being a small property, it is very personalized. The rooms are small but comfortable and well appointed. My only complaint is that there is no room service option but overall I would rate it very highly and recommend it to anyone looking for something with a bit of personality in a town that is really not renowned for that type of service. The restaurant, Ember is great as well but the portions are a little on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: coolcaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 was recommended to me by a colleague who works in our Singapore office. Compared to everywhere else I considered, it's really really good value. Yes, the rooms are small, but perfectly adequate for a night or two. I have to admit I paid the extra for a double, even though I was on my own, and it was great. Plenty of space under the bed for my bags, the hanging space was more than adequate even though it wasn't actually a wardrobe, I didn't have a problem with the shower arrangement, and loved that there was free Diet Coke in the mini fridge. The location is also good - near to an MRT station, and a short walk from all the shops, restaurants and temples of Chinatown. SO much more character than many of the chain hotels down town. I've already recommended it to a few friends, and I'd definitely stay here again if I was in Singapore for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel right next to Chinatown with the best service”
Reviews.Author: trw1089
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to this hotel after being recommended to me by a colleague. A unique hotel, with some fantastic furniture and unusual room layouts (every one is different apparently). First time I've stayed in a room with a toilet in the shower, but if you are on your own or are not bothered about privacy, it's great to experience something a little different. My only niggle was not enough hot water in the shower but on advising the staff it seemed I may have turned off the wrong button, so they get the benefit of the doubt. By the way, the service was excellent and the staff so friendly. Highly recommend staying there just for that.

Reviews.Title: “"Reasonably priced, Great Location, Enjoyed our stay"”
Reviews.Author: MCM85
Reviews.Content: To put our stay into context, we used our flight change in Singapore (on route to Bali) as an opportunity to take a couple of days to explore this amazing city. Despite only staying in the hotel for one night, we were very impressed. As mentioned in some of the other reviews, the rooms in Hotel 1929 are quite small, but suprisingly accomadating. Our room was clean and provided ample facilities (Air-Con,Safe,Flat Screen TV, i Pod dock) plus a neat little ensuite shower/toilet room. However the most endearing quality of Hotel 1929 was the staff. From the moment we checked in, the reception desk went out of there way to enusre that we were comfortable with the location of the hotel in relation to the major tourists spots and knowing that we had limited time, reccomended we take the city tour bus (Well worth doing). The Hotel has a great location. Situated on the frindge of Chinatown, guests are a walk or short tube ride away from destinations such as Raffles Place, City Hall or Little India, not to mention a stones throw from the bustle of Smith Street where you can enjoy the lively atmosphere over a cold beer and some delicious freshly cooked seafood (Chilli Crab - A must have!). The pick up stop for the city tour bus is just around the corner (opposite the peoples theatre) and to get specific destinations, you are 5 minutes from the Outram Park tube station. Breakfast was basic and ranged from traditional asian dishes to and American style breakfasts (Eggs/Bacon/Toast etc). Perfect, if you need some decent food to set you up for a busy day of exploring or are heading back to the airport to catch your connecting flight. Unfortionately there are some negatives about the Hotel. The walls are noticeably thin which means that sleeping can be difficult if there is music playing at night in the local bars. In summary, we had a short time in Singapore and were primarily looking for somewhere to stay that was comfortable and clean with good facilities. Hotel 1929 satisfied this criteria and more, however if you are traveling with a family or staying for a longer period of time, then this hotel might not be as appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Small, perfectly formed (if you're not too tall)”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: This is the smallest hotel room I've stayed in for several years - the bed is 6 feet and two inches long, sandwiched between window and the wall of the adjacent room's bathroom, the shower is directly above the toilet, and the wardrobe is three coat-hangers on a rail above the end of the bed. That said, it's not uncomfortable, although I'd resist recommending it to anyone taller than 6 feet for fear they'd get wedged in the bed and be incapable of checking out the next day. I did see a big guy in the lobby on the evening I checked in, and he seemed pretty cheerful, so perhaps there are some larger rooms. Perhaps. You're not paying for a vast amount of space here; you're getting a good location, on the edge of Chinatown and a short walk into the middle of the city. It's great for me: a 15 minute saunter through Singapore to the office, less than 10 minutes from the MRT. The soundproofing is not that great - from the bed one can hear conversations in the corridor outside, and the door allows a bit of light in from outside as well, but that didn't prevent me from sleeping. The staff are very friendly; I've stayed in a few places in Singapore before that didn't feel very welcoming, but the lady on the front-desk was very helpful in explaining the area to me, and at breakfast the staff were very attentive, bringing my attention to all the food on offer (and bringing food over to my table without me even having to ask). Breakfast itself isn't too remarkable; a combination of toast, cereal, and eggs any way you like them, but it's all fresh and clean. Free wi-fi is something of a bonus, and it gives a good, fast connection to the outside world. The last thing you want when sat in a miniaturised room on your own on a business trip is to feel cut off from the outside world; I could happily talk on Skype without the connection breaking up, which is better than in many more expensive hotels I've stayed in. The room also has an ipod dock, a wide screen TV (slightly larger than my laptop) and the world's smallest fridge which contains complimentary water. A little spartan, then, but it's clean and tidy and well-situated; just not the kind of place you're going to spend all your time inside when you could be enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great Use of Space”
Reviews.Author: juantwomany
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers note, the rooms are small but they have all you need. It is clear the owners though very well how to maximize the use of space. Since Singapore has its fair share of glass buildings, I found this a more interesting place than other parts of town. There is a beautifully decorated temple at the end of the street, for example. My bed was great and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: RPaderna
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to stay at a boutique hotel in Singapore and I now regret not having done it sooner. In my opinion, the Chinatown location of the hotel is its strongest asset. The nicely preserved, historic structures (called shophouses by the locals) sorrounding this quaint property is a dramatic departure from the steel and glass buildings that litter this island- nation. Staying at this hotel will surely add a hint of nostalgia to anyone's itinerary. The Outram Park MRT Station is a quick 5 minutes walk away should one prefer to explore upscale shopping areas like Marina Bay or Orchard Road. The boutique property itself is quite small and so are the rooms. Upon entering the room assigned to me, I was quite thankful to be a solo traveller because it was indeed quite small. I cannot imagine how 2 adults with luggages can fit comfortably inside the room! But what the hotel lacks in size and amenities, it more than makes up for in the efficient design of the rooms, friendly service from all the staff, and a homey atmosphere that invites one to relax ater a tiring day of exploring this bustling city . The comfortable bed, shower with good water pressure and free in-room wifi will likewise please most travellers. Lastly, the inclusive breakfast was simple but filling.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing people - Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huw T
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. I was made to feel welcome from the moment I arrived, to the moment I regretfully had to go home! The staff were all incredibly polite, caring, and friendly; whilst always happy to do their best to help: whether that was booking taxis, or recommending places to go. I stayed in a deluxe room on my own for the 3 weeks while I was there, and never had any issues with the size of the room or privacy. My room was left spotless after being cleaned every day. In addition I was able to make use of the laundry services, for my work shirts and gym kit, which was quick and efficient (about 2 days), with my clothes being neatly ironed and placed in my room once finished. I can't forget to mention the fantastic restaurant that is also in the hotel. I ate there on two occasions during my stay, and had fantastic, delicious meals both times! A definite must! All in all I felt like I was part of a family whilst I stayed at the hotel. I grew very fond of all the staff and was sad to leave by the end. Everything about the hotel was fantastic, and I would strongly recommend people stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean and very confortable”
Reviews.Author: bon_vivant76
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel close to the shopping area, choose a hotel at the Orchard Road where the malls are located (with Gucci, Cartier, Louis Vuitton, Hermès, etc). The location of 1929 is good. It is in Chinatown's centre, 3 minutes walking from the Chinatown tube station. Then, it takes 15 minutes until Raffles Place or Esplanade, the downtown of Singapore. Chinatown is certainly one of the best places to stay in Singapore, with all its specific Chinese culture in all of its streets and corners, in particular, markets and restaurants. 1929 is a very small hotel, with very tiny rooms and corridors. However, the hotel is extremely clean (bed, pillow, WC), comfortable and charming . The room is cleaned everyday and we got new towels everyday too. The staff is very, very helpful, cooperative, like all Singaporean people. Anything you need, the staff will provide you (restaurant reservations, transportation, maps orientations, etc.). The breakfast is not satisfactory: one yogurt, orange juice in a dwarf glass, one croissant with butter, with eggs (scramble, boiled or fried). Finally, the restaurant of the hotel is called Ember and is run by a chef different from the hotel's owner. The cuisine is exquisite and absolutely delicious. My gf and I ended up knowing that Ember is nowadays one of the trendiest restaurants in Singapore. Considering the price we paid, this is certainly a hotel I recommend to my friends – couples or not (aged between 20 and 40).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: anne75015
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my son (6 years old) during a few days on a stopover in Singapore. I knew that Singapore is very expensive compared with other Asian nearby countries, so I spent a lot of time looking for an affordable hotel but spotless, extremely clean and comfortable. When travelling with my son, cleanliness is essential and I was not disappointed at the 1929. Even if the room is small and the bathroom tiny as other travellers already said, it's very well designed, comfortable. Bathroom is extremely clean, towels and bedsheets are spotless white of course, and even if it's small, I could easily store the big suitcase and the bags and organize the space quite easily (clothes, toys, books and all equipment for a kid!). Even if the room is small, we have been able to stay and have some rest in the room in the afternoon of our arrival, and my son could play in the room without feeling the need to go out! The room had a window in the backyard so it's quiet and calm enough. Breakfast is ok, restaurant is a nice place with a view on the street. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Location is perfect just a few minutes from Outram Park metro, with some good restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Not for claustrophobes”
Reviews.Author: Hilltriber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is restored, and presumably built in 1929. It is nicely refurbished. Be aware that the rooms are very tiny and cramped: in real estate, it is called "shoebox" room. There is something charming about smallness: like staying in a toy-house. There is a tiny refrigerator in the room, and it is really cute: stores 2 coke cans & 2 bottles of water. But when you get out of the bathroom, you are likely to bump into the wash basin or the bed. The hotel staff try their best to be pleasant. The breakfast is adequate, provided you dont stay more than 2 days -- otherwise you will be bored with the same fare. The location is in Chinatown. Stay here if you spend most of your time out sightseeing. Otherwise, you will feel very confined in tight spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TR9818
Reviews.Content: Just one warning: in this hotel, it is not about room size. The rooms might be tiny but you don't spend a hole day in the room, right? For us, the size was not a problem, because the room was very clean, well equipped (TV, minibar with free water/coke/diet coke and cookies every day) and it is really nicely done, the colors are matching and the room had a great, modern style. We asked for a room with window when we made the booking and we got one. The bed was very comfortable, the shower and the toilet are in one room, but they constructed the floor in a way that the toilet hardly gets wet if you shower. The people at the reception - without exception - were very friendly and helpful, one of the receptionists even opened the door of the taxi for me. The breakfast was really good, they have a good choice and you can get eggs any style. The location is excellent, it takes you around 5 minutes to walk to the next subway station. The only drawback is the relatively high price - but this is probably the same with every hotel in Singapore. If we visit Singapore again, we would definitely stay at this very charming, stylish hotel with its friendly staff. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travellers seeking peaceful nights”
Reviews.Author: Starfield11
Reviews.Content: I feel a bit bad about having to write a critical review about this nice little hotel in the heart of Chinatown as there are a few absolute positives as well. First the positive: The staff in this hotel is warm and friendly and make you feel instantly at home. The lady at breakfast always remembered my breakfast preferences which is one of those nice little details that help make you feel at home (which is quite nice if you have to travel often for work). Furthermore, the hotel has some nice design features and overall the quality of the furniture is good. I liked the relatively modern design of the rooms. The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice. The shower however was virtually on top of the toilet which is more something one would expect in a youth hostel. The reason for this is that the rooms are absolutely tiny (superior rooms), so this is definitely not recommended for people that like big rooms. For me this is no problem and I actually even wished for a smaller room after the first night in a street-facing deluxe room (which were bigger, perhaps the size of a superior room in other hotels). I asked for the transfer though because the street facing rooms were incredibly noisy (room 209). It seems that the hotel only has single glazing (apart from the ancient outside shutters which give the building its colonial look and feel) which offers absolutely no noise isolation. I was able to overhear normal conversations out on the street and sat straight up in bed when the garbage collectors came by at 1am. Furthermore, you can hear music from karaoke bars down the street. As a business traveller this was not acceptable. The next day my secretary called the hotel and they were very forthcoming in finding a room at the back for me, so once again the service here is impeccable. It would be a great little boutique hotel suitable for business travelers if they can sort out the lack of soundproofing in the rooms. 4 stars if not for the noise...

Reviews.Title: “Very small but still perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: LondonRouge
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredibly small but this is a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulTas
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Very conveneint to Chinatown and close to 2 MRT stations. I stayed for 7 nights and found the rooms cozy, well appointed, very clean and quiet. They are small, but this is Asia - if you want a large room you should holiday in USA! Staff were very freindly and helpful. English-style breakfast was a good start to the day. No hesitation in recommending this hotel to friends. Will definitely visit Singapore & this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite rooms with outside baths!”
Reviews.Author: Chrismema09
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Borneo having just climbed mt Kinabalu and on seeing the tiny standard room, decided to upgrade to the suite. It was a great, airy room with an outside bath, nespresso machine, wifi etc. The breakfast was adequate and the two ladies that worked on reception in the afternoons were very charming. The only bad point was that the lift was broken for the first couple of days, meaning we had to carry our bags to the 4th fllo - not great with aching legs!

Reviews.Title: “Small and noisy hotel with nice personel”
Reviews.Author: GlobTrotting
Reviews.Content: 1929 is located in the heart of Singapore's Chinatown, on a nice street filled with nice shops and lovely restaurants. On the positive side, the hotel is very fresh, with trendy design and style, and the staff is most helpful. But, as mentioned in earlier reviews, the rooms are small and not that functional : shower over the toilet, no wardrobe or place to hang clothes, and no space to store luggage. This would have been fine had not our room but so unbearably noisy. Indeed, our room was on floor 2, just overlooking the street, and had only single-glazed window. So much for soundproofing ! Even though we stayed at weekdays and the hustle and bustle outside was not at its maximum, we could hear all conversations from the neighbouring bar terraces until late into the night, Not to mention the cars passing just below with a large buzz. Earplugs did not help, so rest was not somehing we could enjoy that much. When we mentioned the noise problem to the reception we were suggested another room - still on the street side but 2 floors up - I doubt that would have helped given the noise level outside. Maybe a room on the inside could have worked, but the hotel was fully booked. Breakfast was just decent, but given the rather low price of the rooms (on Singapore scales) we were not expecting a gigantic buffet. My suggestion: go out and buy a local breakfast in one of the many stalls and small restaurants around. All in all, unless you are looking for sleepless nights in Singapore, look for other accomodation options.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Nicodem
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 is a decent place to stay if you are travelling alone, looking for something simple and like Chinese food. If you are travelling with a partner or family, you should certainly avoid this place. The rooms are tiny (almost comical) with bathrooms the size of a phone box. The shower is fitted above the toilet giving the concept of forward-thinking a whole new meaning and degree of importance. Otherwise the architecture and interior design are appealing and modern. Breakfast is below average with hardly any variety or choice in the food and drinks on offer. Staff are generally friendly. One should definitely like authentic Chinese food as the hotel is situated in the middle of China town and finding any other type of cuisine is near impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Quirky Except For The Front Office/Reception”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulFreak
Reviews.Content: I love quirky places so I personally love 1929! You can see that a lot of thought has been put on this boutique hotel: Room: We stayed in the double room and sure it was tiny. But pretty, very pretty. I appreciate the free wifi and the comfortable bed. If you're claustrophobic though, I'd advise you to not go for this place. Location: Love the location! It's charming and you have a selection of local food and fine dining as well. I personally had a nice time at Eight cafe at Bukit Pasoh, which is just a few minutes walk away from the hotel. What else? The jacuzzi on the 2nd floor was a cute touch to the hotel, the breakfast is so-so but the breakfast buffet staff was very efficient and nice! One last thing, the front desk was the only thing that stopped me from giving this hotel a solid 5. For the price that we paid, we expected some warmth from them but checkin in and checkin out felt more like a trip to the principal's office rather than a hotel! A genuine smile would have made such a difference.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bab4040
Reviews.Content: Sitting on the out door terrace, drinking tiger beer, preparing the outdoor bath..... Pretty special! Great service, great location. Room is small but very well organized and has everything thing you need. Coffee machine, free fast Internet and great outdoor space. Will come again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The best service, cozy, extremely amazing"”
Reviews.Author: kikeaguilar
Reviews.Content: we were there for a conference over a week, the staff were incredible kind and gentle with our requests and needs, always trying to help you with directions, ideas and the most incredible... by the third day already knew our names and how our breakfast liked it done... is an awesome kinda "boutique" hotel, really nice, cozy, warm, beds are amazing, it's a quiet zone but with tons of things to do around, great restaurant by night, safe area, super clean.... the best is that everyone is so nice to you that they make you feel like home for your stay... is a MUST when in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with all the necessary facilities. Very helpful staff. Good value”
Reviews.Author: luckymumjanet
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel on the edge of the China town area of Singapore not far from Metro station or transport. Very helpful staff. Room clean and tidy with en suite and comfortable bed with TV, fridge and all necessary facilities. Free wireless internet. Excellent nicely cooked breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Compact byt wonderful”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRose79
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice. It is in a wonderful location and close to the metro system for exploring further afield. Staff are very friendly and helpful and I was impressed that they had identified on my second visit that i had stayed previously. This certainly shows an attention to details that makes you feel a valued customer. The rooms are certainly on the small side, but it is easy to work within the space. You can easily get your suitcase under the bed and each day take out what I need and put away things I don't need. I don't really understand people's need for masses of space in a room - just how long do you spend there when you have a city to explore?!! The decor throughout is really quirky and cool and I love the little touches like the free drink in your room, and the funnky furniture dotted around. The breakfast is wonderful and varied - cooked breakfast, cereal and fruit all on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky, great service, but rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Content: I knew from reading other reviews that the room would be small, and it was. But for a weekend break without much luggage it wasn't a big problem. It was clean, stylish and made for a good night's sleep. Service was very friendly and the hotel is in a pretty good location. I'd definitely prefer this to a bland chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but very tiny and noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhilippePalmsSpring
Reviews.Content: Trendy boutique hotel offering good location in the middle of the charming Chinatown. But bedrooms are really small. I had the feeling to stay in a closet. I stayed 4 nights and had 3 different rooms! In the first one the safe box was out of order, in the second when I wok up the wooden floor was wet due to condensation problem or lick, the third one was ok. But all were so tiny, I didn’t know where to store my cloth and luggage… If you still want to stay at 1929 (big mistake to my humble point of view), bring your earplugs! On the street side, you will enjoy the traffic and on the back side the AC engines make a strong (and vibrant) noise night and day. One more thing about the lack of sound proof: walls between bedrooms are so thin that you share your privacy with your neighbors (and vice versa), if you see what I mean. Last drawback, the breakfast buffet is simply ridiculous. The only good point are the employees who try to do there best to face all those major problems with customers. But… it’s not enough to recommend this pretentious and expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: noside666
Reviews.Content: I paid sgd300 after taxes for a night stay at one of the only two suites available at the hotel. The rm is much smaller than I expected, so as the little tv. Nothing much to wow about except the big tub outside in the balcony tat is half the size of the room. But it is open for the viewing pleasure to the neighbourhood flats surrounding the hotel as well. So, the tub is best utilized in e night unless u r an exhibitionist! Basic amenities are provided adequate for a comfortable stay. There is a small shower and toilet bowl inside the rm. A queensize bed which is strangely elevated. Reception is great as I was able to chk in earlier than the usual 3pm and chk out later at 1pm. I'm impressed by the nespresso machine provided with complimentary coffees. All in all I would think it as an overpriced tiny retro rm to stay. Perhaps the cheaper rm will b a better deal? Unless the hotel fenced up the outdoor tub nicely, the tub seemed rather unusable.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended with Caveats”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 is a boutique hotel located in a renovated area of Chinatown. It is modern and clean with a top notch and friendly staff. However, if you are going to stay here keep in mind the single rooms are EXTREMELY small. The only place to put my roll aboard suitcase was the under the bed. The "en-suite" bathroom with the toilet, shower and basin in a single unit can be annoying after awhile. The Hindu temple down the street rings a loud bell early some mornings, although it was not a big of an issue for me because the bed was really comfortable. I checked out a double room, and it is somewhat larger, although for 2 persons, it will also be tight. If small hotel rooms are not an issue for you, this hotel is otherwise recommended. The free internet in the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good location, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Munwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Chinatown and is walking distance to two MRT stations. The staff were very friendly and helpful. While the room was small, it was very clean and had all the amenities I needed. If you're travelling by yourself the standard single bed room with toilet and shower should be big enough. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, but a few problems - would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: clmokinawa
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very tiny but looks nice. We never ate at the restaurant, but it looked nice as well. The place is decently clean, but the rooms are tinier than my childhood bedroom! And we didn't even get the smallest room type! The bed takes up all of the floor space - my husband and I had to either sit on the bed or bump into eachother to pass eachother to get to the "bathroom", which was a tiny square glass (yes, completely see-through) enclosure that had the shower head right over the toilet. Yes, you have to get the toilet wet in order to shower in there. The shower/toilet area is also not sealed (the door doesn't close all the way - there's a crack left open when the door is "shut"). You may have better luck, but the last night we were there, we were dripped on all night with cold water - their air conditioner units are mounted on the wall right over the headboard, and ours decided to break in the middle of the night and drip on us all night - we slept at the foot of the bed and tried to keep towels near the headboard, but we were drenched by morning. The hotel is one step above a hostel - its an okay place, but definately was the worst experience I've ever had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: H0meles5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1929 for two nights in August, we wanted to visit Singapore and keep the expenses low. The hotel is ok, standard rooms are tiny but nice (nice, not amazing) but I suppose that is what you get in Singapore for that price. All the hype about it being a "design hotel" is, in fact, just hype. They do have some nice vintage pieces in the lobby but the place as a whole is nothing special. If you expect a stylish hotel renovated by a trendy architect go elsewhere. Staff is not rude but not very helpful either. I must say we found their restaurant to be excellent (though not cheap), but then again the restaurant staff was quite cold and stuck up. A little more friendliness would help.

Reviews.Title: “Unique niche experience”
Reviews.Author: nekomancy
Reviews.Content: I loved the idea of 1929. The room was a single and space was uniquely designed to maximize efficient space. I especially like how the shower was built in and created the illusion of bigger space. The bed was comfortable and the staff was quite helpful throughout my stay. I didn't mind the noise at night. It wasn't too much during the night and I found it soothing to walk back to the hotel from the MRT Chinatown. The location was especially convenient for shopping, traveling around Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Happy customer”
Reviews.Author: Davo1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 1929 as a solo traveller for three nights. I knew that the room would be on the small side and that the shower was over the toilet so it was no surprise. Rooms were very modern and clean. Found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The location was ideal being very central to Chinatown and the bars on Neil Road. I felt very safe in this area, particularly when returning to the hotel after 2am most mornings. I had a room on the 2nd floor that faced the street and was not worried by street noise nor being near the lift. The bed was very comfortable and I slept soundly. Wifi internet worked a treat. I would happily stay here again. If I could offer one suggestion, it would be to replace some of the tired looking chairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Small but quaint, unique, comfortable and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Shaikhah23
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at Hotel 1929 for a short staycation from 23rd to 24th of October. We were housed in the lovely terrace suite which came with an outdoor bath. The room was well furnished with a very comfortable bed, Nespresso machine and Kiehl's products. The outdoor bath is quirky and if you are modest or shy you may want to take a bath (fully clothed perhaps) at night instead of in the day as there are high rise residential blocks nearby which allows residents to easily see what you are up to in the bath. But other than that, taking a bath under the night sky was really wonderful. The only complaint that we had was probably the lack of hot water. The hot water would be available for a short period of time before turning cold if turned on for too long. Other than that, the hotel had a good spread of breakfast, it is located right in the heart of Chinatown and near a train station which allows for convenient access to other parts of Singapore. You can also walk from the hotel to famous landmarks in Chinatown such as the Sri Mariamman Temple and Thian Hock Keng Temple. The hotel staff were very attentive and cheerful and would not hesitate to help you. Overall, we felt that you get your money's worth if you opt for the more expensive rooms and you will definitely enjoy your stay at this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: biptutti
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to staying here, but it was a bit of a let down. The room (superior double) was so tiny you vould get your duitcase out unless on the bed. Extremely noisy, not just from road noise but also through the paper thin walls. On the positive, nice outdoor courtyard with spa and really cute colonial bldg lined street. Close to train line that goes straight to the airport and too mega mall land near Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Epicenter of bustling Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Jerping
Reviews.Content: the location of hotel 1929 is very good. walking distance from 2 mrt stations. lots of conveniences around the hotel. within 5-minute walking distances to food, shopping and public transport. though not on the budget pricing, the convenience and service was exemplary. i like the small room with attached bathroom. the location is even better than bencoolen street hotels. if you are not into orchard road shopping, this is one of the best..

Reviews.Title: “Unique - recommended boutique hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: beingkw
Reviews.Content: Welcoming staff, extremely comfortable bed and refreshingly characterful design. On the edge of Chinatown. Free Wifi although wouldnt describe it as high speed! Generous breakfast. Our room was not cheap (or large) - but compared to other places in Singapore it was reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Small but quaint.”
Reviews.Author: aussiewill
Reviews.Content: We had 2 single rooms beside each other. Small rooms with single beds and trendy shower area. Looks good. But noisy. Stayed 3 nights and every morning about 5am someone would walk up and down the corridore which is timber and make a racket. I complained on the last morning but I dont think they were too concerned. The breakfast that comes with it is large and tasty. The location is right in the heart of china town. Great night markets and places to eat. There is a train station about 3 mins away. It has a spa area which was a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quirky hotel but v small room!”
Reviews.Author: HellsBells28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights whilst travelling to Australia. The hotel has a nice vibe and is nicely decorated. Our room was fine for us, but very small. I wouldnt have wanted to be there much longer but for 3 nights was fine. It was v clean and modern. The breakfast is good and the location isn't too bad. The hotel will order you a taxi which is helpful and held our luggage as we had a late flight. All in all a good choice for a reasonably priced city break

Reviews.Title: “attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: kas79
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews about rooms being tiny but was not prepared for how tiny,one person had to be on the bed to let the other person move round the room.cases had to be put under the bed and the shower was over the toilet very small but it was only for sleeping the staff were the most attentive we had come across during our 6 week travels they remembered you and called you by name, and nothing was too much trouble, we asked if we could keep the room after checkout time and they organized another room to be avaiable to shower prior to leaving for our flight. It is close to the hop on hop off bus and public transport system there was access to free internet and even though we didn't eat in the resturant it appear to be full for both lunch and the evening meal for the 3 days we were there breakfast was included in the price and of a high standard We would stay here again but request a larger room

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: JonryanNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 was just right. Rooms small but the price was not too high. It is cute, boutique, hipe. They lend you MacBooks for free use in the lobby. It is right in the middle of China town. I have been to Singapore many times and will now return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service attitude lets down a unique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: places2cthingstodo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with my partner for a mid week break/getaway and due to full occupancy was only able to secure the Terrace Suite. The stay was uneventful and we expected some level of noise, not only from the external environment but from the housekeeping staff walking along the corridors outside the rooms. The real service surprise came after we had left the hotel. I received a call from the hotel telling me that they will have to charge me for the bedsheets as it was stained. (My partner had her monthly cycle start during teh stay). They told me that they will attempt to clean this and if it fails, they will chareg me for the sheets. I have never heard of any hotels imposing this type of requirements on their guests. Naturally, I asked to speak to the supervisor who then restated their position. They asked me for my email address to "keep me advised of their cleaning progress"! This is not the first time I have stayed at this hotel or its sister hotel, the New Majestic. I have found on many occasions the servcie to be of poor standards and unaccomodating. I am not sure if the owner, Mr Loh is aware of the service let down which mars the experience of the guests in what is an unusual and unique hotel experience. I shall not return and would really hope the owner would pay attention to the service attitude of the staff. I would also add that I called earlier in the morning to ask if the room would be available for an early check in after 1pm, but receievd a very unhelpful "the check is time is after 3pm! If you want to come early we can keep your bags at the counter". Its a real let down and the sheets issue is just simply unheard of.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel that wins because of great location and food”
Reviews.Author: redh0rn
Reviews.Content: 1929 has a well-deserved reputation for small-sized rooms and I had my bouts of hesitation before confirming it for my week-long stay in Singapore. I specifically requested for the largest room available, and yet my fears came true. The room was smaller than any hotel room I have ever stayed in, period. A colleague who had checked-in a day earlier had an even smaller room! Having said that, it is surprisingly easy to adjust to a small room once you know what to expect. I had a nice balcony that opened to Keong Saik Road, the bed was comfortable and basic amenities were all there - including the tiniest fridge I've ever seen in a hotel room! Bathroom however stood out for its size - the shower was placed right above the toilet commode and it was a challenge to get a good shower. However, the hotel's location right next to China Town nearly made up for all the flaws, and the food at their restaurant was nothing short of brilliant. I've never had better breakfast in my life. Of course, the variety of chairs in all shapes and sizes add their bit to the quirkiness. In summary, I'd recommend this hotel to solo travelers who like to stay close to where the action is (China Town in this case) and have a taste for quirkiness. Couples and finicky travelers would do well to stay away from this hotel, as will anyone who finds the idea of a 8ft x 8ft hotel room difficult to digest.

Reviews.Title: “clean and conveniently located hotel but small in size!!”
Reviews.Author: armrap
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at Hotel 1929 this month - booked into a Superior room the first time and was shocked by how small the room was - you could not swing a cat, as they say!! However the room was very clean, the staff very attentive and the location handy to local attractions and public transport. I returned to the hotel almost 2 weeks later and was fortunate to be upgraded to a Deluxe room - much bigger and this is will be the type of room I will book in the future. Yes, I will return and certainly do recommend this property to anyone wishing to stay in the Chinatown district.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & reasonable for Single Traveller and Couple.”
Reviews.Author: MareK4
Reviews.Content: Even though This Hotel is located in ChinaTown, the room design is modern. It's like a Shanghai. The room fee is very lower than other famous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem indeed :)”
Reviews.Author: vmvpinay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, the location is perfect, few minutes walk to both Outram and Chinatown MRT, 1 station away from Harbourfront (Outram MRT), 7-11 store just few steps away from the hotel, a lot of restaurants nearby, approachable/helpful staffs and what else do you expect from Chinatown- cheap food and bargain items for those who love to shop! The hotel is super "cute", the room is just enough for one (i booked single room anyway). there's not much space to move around but you have everything you need, a tv, a free wifi, a good shower, a mini fridge, a telephone, free breakfast, a comfy bed.. and the room is clean!! Jacuzzi also just in front of my hotel room. The only thing I did not enjoy is that the hotel is beside the road, the 1st night there, I had nightmares! Coz it was so noisy outside and my room is only on the 2nd floor. I can't sleep with the noise.. You don't even need to open any lights coz the street lights are enough to illuminate your room. :( But the 2nd night i already know what to expect so I was able to sleep or maybe I am just too tired with the whole day roaming around the city that the noise did not bother my sleep. :) All in all this is definitely a good hotel. I have stayed at Orchard Rd. and Victoria St. hotels before and I can say my stay here is better. Will recommend it to everyone..

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: lvivie
Reviews.Content: cheap, nice but very noisy. good location and arty decoration. Rooms are as well quite small

Reviews.Title: “Small, nicely appointed, good location”
Reviews.Author: wheezil
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore before Chinese New Year, and being in the Chinatown area was really fun. Its right next to a Hindu temple that makes ridiculous noise every once in a while, but never at late hours. Easy walk to two metro stops. Included breakfast was very good, free wifi works well enough for skype to USA, building felt secure and safe, staff was great, everything was clean, in-room safe was big enough for netbook but not laptop. Decor is trendy and rooms are small, so if you need to sprawl this isn't the place for you. The in-room shower is a "wet room" with toilet and shower in one place, so if you are squeamish about a wet toilet you might want to reconsider. It has a decor "theme" of designer chairs, which is kind of quaint, but they aren't necessarily useful as chairs per se. Beds are very comfortable. The rooms are not all identical. Ours was street-facing and the occasional garbage truck would wake us up (even with earplugs in). There are also inward-facing rooms but we didn't like the cloistered feeling of them. We booked this for SGD 220 or so, which seemed about average for a decent room in this expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find, good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: MAWander
Reviews.Content: I concur with many of the more positive reviews of this hotel: in a great Chinatown location, stylish, friendly service, comfortable bed, free wireless (worked fine every time), absolutely quiet (my room faced the back), and reasonably priced for Singapore accomodation. The single room was, indeed, incredibly small, but I knew that going in and was more delighted with the clever design and nice fittings than bugged by lack of space. I would add that I arrived after midnight and only spent one additional night, spending very little time in the room itself except to sleep and bathe. Particularly liked the high quality bedding, rain shower, and tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast was simple but absolutely fine, nice fruits, good coffee, cereals, pastry, toast, yogurt, juices, and eggs if you wished. Couldn't ask for more. Lovely staff at the desk arranged wake-up calls, transport, etc. Knew me by name and smiled warmly... What's not to like, really?

Reviews.Title: “OK for leisure not good for business”
Reviews.Author: Charleyquant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when in Singapore for work and was looking for something different to the big chains that i normally stay in there It is certainly a pretty stylish 'boutique' hotel but definitely only suitable for leisure travellers. The room i had which was a deluxe room really was teeny and the website gives no indication of size so was very annoyed that it was quite so small, literally there isn't even a foot between bed/bathroom/desk but just about adequate for one person. The desk is pretty much a shelf so you can't work on a laptop properly. The wireless service wouldn't work effectively ( kept losing connection every 5 minutes ) and even using the cable wasn't consistent - the staff tried to sort this out and assured me that i was the only one to complain but clearly there have been issues before and the excuses paltry ,the receptionist told me at one point there were too many people trying to access at once.... give me a break! The room is stylish and beds are comfy but it is a very noisy location with a temple next door chiming prayers early in the morning, lots of traffic noise and rubbish collection at 2am kept me awake each night. I can only guess that those who reviewed in the press that the hotel are proud of were staying in the suites at the back of the hotel with less noise. I know that is is converted building in a conservation area so space is limited but the website could be more realistic about size of rooms. Overall I'd say if you are a leisure traveller who is on a budget and won't be in your room much then go for it. If you're a business traveller looking for something different in Singapore - the basic necessities of good internet and space to work don't live up to expectations needed to work efficiently in your room. + points are: Stylish Cheap Good restaurant - points are: Tiny rooms Not good for Business Bad wireless/internet access Very noisy

Reviews.Title: “A great find...”
Reviews.Author: ColmMBangkok
Reviews.Content: Yes, I read the reviews before booking, and yes, the rooms are a bit small. But, hey, that was fine by us. Myself, my wife and 12 year old daughter stayed here for 3 nights for a weekend break in mid December 2009 and we all were delighted with this find. The location was excellent - 15ish minutes from the middle of Orchard road, less than 10 mins from Boat Quay (all by taxi which was very cheap)..perfect. The staff could not do enough for us. All were fantastic. Both of our rooms were very clean and tidy. Our daughter was amazed by the decor, and had to check out our room to compare! Both my wife and I have stayed in Singapore before and we stayed on Orchard road, but because we were bringing our daughter for a holiday, we wanted to stay somewhere with a more 'personal touch'. And we found it. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit in a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetraveller_10
Reviews.Content: A very nice and friendly hotel situated in genuine part of old Singapore. The staff was just great, very nice, friendly and service minded. We realy like this hotel and its staff and we will go back there now in april.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CricketGirlDarwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Chinatown and although the rooms are small they are clean and well presented for the space. Would definitely stay again on one of our Singapore weekends.

Reviews.Title: “First impression of Singapore was a good one”
Reviews.Author: Sarawak_Ranger
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1929 is one of the boutique hotel, being converted from an old building to a new one. My first impression was the staff was great and fast in checking me in. Everyone was cosy and with a certain high class put into it. The room, like in other reviews were small but practical. It was enough for a quiet relaxation and everything was in place. The staff greets you with a simple 'Good morning Sir' and attends to my every need. Location was good, being in the middle of China Town and is accesible both with MRT, taxi or bus. In fact, one need not travel far to enjoy a good part of Singapore. Breakfast was cosy and simple, nothing fancy but enough to start a new day. As for the room, basic amenities can be found and everything is new. A little reminder to say that the room is a bit small but in a way practical. I surely be coming back for a longer period time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but still a great and value hotel”
Reviews.Author: twofourseven
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights while we were visiting Singapore. We found the hotel online and saw that the location was good and the price was perfect. Yes, the rooms are very small, but they are clean and well presented. While we were there we did change rooms to make sure that we got as much space as possible. But that said out intention was to spend time out in Singapore than in the hotel. The staff were helpful and polite and given that it was in Chinatown and close to the MTR 1929 Hotel was great. Oh, and the wi-fi and internet were free, which was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Retro stylings in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: tripleflip
Reviews.Content: Searching for an affordable boutique hotel in Singapore was more difficult than I imagined; at the time Hotel 1929 seemed to be a good compromise between style, comfort and price.
