I was a little uncertain about the location but it seemed reasonably close to a metro stop (it is, at most a 10 minute walk). I arrived after 9 in the evening and the taxi had trouble finding the hotel. It is a small property in Chinatown so make sure you have the hotel's number in case the driver needs to confirm the location. Check-in was fast and friendly. The superior double room is very small, but fine for a solo traveller. I think it would be a tight squeeze for a couple though. Bathroom is a wet room with shower and toilet enclosed in glass walls. TV is a small LCD screen with limited channels. The best part of the room is the bed; very comfy and high-quality linens. Other than the size of the room, the major caveat is noise. The street outside of the hotel is noisy at night with revellers. I did stay on Friday and Saturday nights though, so I can't say what the conditions are on weeknights. The noise didn't bother me but light sleepers should be aware. The included breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was good. Eggs cooked to order; continental breakfast items buffet style. All in all, I had a pleasant stay at Hotel 1929. For $150 SGD a night (including tax), I'm not sure if I can find better in Singapore but I really can't find much fault with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueberrywig
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was travelling alone and it had such good reviews on trip advisor. The reviews were spot on, I loved it! I had a beautifully designed compact and cosy single room. It was clean and bright and did not feel cramped at all. The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel had a retro boutiquy feel to it. The location is great, in Chinatown close to various shopping centres and Outram Park train station, aswell as the main bus routes and even the hop on hop off bus tours. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SebastiaanD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Chinatown, so the location is great if you come to Singapore to party. If you like an authentic atmosphere, this is the place for you. The hotel is in an old colonial building, and plenty of old photo's on the wall testify to Singapore's history. Also, the owner is a collector of designer chairs, which gives the whole place a quircky and trendy feel. The rooms however are extremely small (the toilet also serves as the shower). But because of the cheap prices of the rooms, you quickly discard that. Another great feature of this place is its restaurant. Very good international cuisine, with a trendy ambiance, all be it rather on the expensive side. Overall a good hotel if you plan to visit Singapore and not spend a lot of time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Ex-brothel now charming boutique hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Asiabytes
Reviews.Content: This is swishy, tidy little boutique hotel in a 1920s building on the edge of Chinatown. Pluses: great staff, free Internet and buffet breakfast, outdoor jacuzzi. Minuses: some rooms very small, somewhat overpriced. I stayed in two rooms here - one was quite cramped. The friendly staff gave me a bigger room on the second night for the same rate. There's a great restaurant on the premises. I was in town to see the great Singapore Zoo and the Bukit Timah nature reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Bad after sales service”
Reviews.Author: JungKwek
Reviews.Content: Check in on the 14th Feb. To spend my stay atHotel 1929 with my gf for valentine. Made some special arrangment with Hotel 1929. Glad they were prompt and nice. Thats the first impression i have on them. Very good. But as promise by their staff about the room rates. I didn't pay the amount i was told in the end. And was told to sign something when i arrive on that day when i was about to do my check in. Wasn't explain what's the letter about. The staff there didnt bother to clarify the room rates at e front desk either. Was told to pay a higher amount and was told there would be a refund the next day i check out. In the end they ridiculously gave me a $0.20 refund. Astonish. My jaws almost drop. They promise to get back to me after the investigation of whats going on. No phone calls from them after investigation. Till i called them myself and they keep the case passing on and on to another person. It was totally disgusting. The fault lies on the staff on yet they push the blame to me telling me that, u signed the letter stating the rates it means you agree to it. No apology and as a guest there wasnt any satisfaction at all. Really bad after sales service. The feeling they give u is, moreover your here only for once and you will never come back. So they don't entertain you after sales service. The amount i spend for the terrace suite wasnt worth it at all. Flickering lights in the bathroom. Stupid control switch for the lights. Outdoor bathroom access was just like a balcony and nothing else but with table chairs and a bathtub outside. Complimentary drinks was like only 2 mineral water and 2 cokes. Theres a stench of smell on their towels too! Overall the room was normal only. But sales service was bad and thats enough. Never will i return to this hotel again nor i will introduce this to any of my friends. This hotel is boycott and thats it. Just like how the staff from hotel 1929 shove me off. Giving me the feeling that, Its your fault and thats it. Don't bother calling hotel 1929 again. Oh ya. He told me that. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Too small to be pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGardner
Reviews.Content: We decided to write a review while searching for a hotel for a new trip in December/January 2008/09 and recalled this hotel. There is cheap and terrible and expensive and terrible. We felt on balance that 1929 falls into the latter. It is a a soulless refurbished building with rooms so small that it was uncomfortable for our five days there, but having pre-paid we decided to grin and bear it. The room was so small that the toilet and shower were together and there was no room to move around. We aren't big westerners but this was "cat swinging" gone extreme. The smallness of the room meant that it never felt comfortable staying there. The breakfast was okay, nothing great. The restaurant was quite good. Location was good, in an area we like. Basic problem is that the room was ridiculously small and making it "boutique" does not alter this. Might be suitable for a slight or small single person.

Reviews.Title: “great place for what I paid...”
Reviews.Author: castorpollux01
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful... Rooms are a bit small but well-designed... If you can live with the fact that the bathroom has glass walls (and that the toilet is sorta in the shower area), it's pretty nice...

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique Hotel; But Once Again Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hui P
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, modern but really small. Interesting bathroom with see-through glass but no bathtub. You can't really invite just anyone up because of the see-through bathroom. They would see everything. Didn't have the breakfast so can't comment. Overall, I wouldn't mind if I am a lone traveller but the room is just too small & inconvenient for more then 1 person.

Reviews.Title: “Nice chairs”
Reviews.Author: Zharik
Reviews.Content: Single rooms are small, but clean and well-designed; great location (8 min. walk from MRT, 2 min. from heart of Chinatown); staff are very friendly and helpful. I gave it a lower rating because when we were there, they were renovating the restaurant, without giving any prior notice. It made for a very unpleasant entry through the lobby (the caustic chemicals), but at least I never had it permeate my room.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare in singapore”
Reviews.Author: BigDJ
Reviews.Content: First of all, give the devil his due credit - the hotel locates very close to China down and there are a lot of restaurants and drink places within walking distance. In addition, the folks at front desk are friendly and polite. However, you may not consider it if you are not doing a back-pack trip. It is worse than an average Super 8 in the US. The room is stunningly small. You have to stand over your toilet tub for a shower. Out of my 5 days' stay, I was told there is no hot water supply. The nice locatin also brings a lot of noises. It won't be surprise if the trash truck wakes you up at 1:00 am. Last but not least, they have very tricky policy. If you book 5 nights and want to check out early, they charge you 5 nights' $, very different from a lot of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mich_t
Reviews.Content: I was rather apprehensive in choosing this hotel after reading the mixed reviews. However, given the budget that I had, decided to give it a shot. Overall, I would say that it exceeded my expectations. I stayed in a single superior room end July for three nights and was charged SGD170++ per night. Room - It was much smaller that the rooms that I was used to, but it was cosy and adequate. The design was certainly hip and the bed was very comfy. Location - Pretty good - five minutes walk to Outram Park MRT station. I felt safe walking from the station, even at about 11 pm. A taxi ride to Suntec City costs bot SGD9 (off-peak hours). There are some nearby small shopping malls and restaurants serving local cuisine. There is a Hindu temple near the hotel but I wasn't disturbed by the noise in the morning. However, I was awoken by the sound of nearby guests closing their doors bot 4am. Service - Booked the room via email. The receptionist was pretty helpful. Food - buffet breakfast consisted of cereal, fruits, juice, bread, meehoon, coffee or tea. Was also offered a plate of English breakfast - sausage, bacon, baked beans and eggs. Tried the set lunch at its restaurant, Ember which was very delicous. Priced at SGD38 ++, service was also wonderful and very efficient. They are open for lunch and dinner every weekday and only open for dinner on Sat. Closed for business on Sunday. Overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “My great stay in Hotel 1929”
Reviews.Author: jenelope
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel 1929 in a single room for a week while in Singapore for a conference. I enjoyed my stay very much. I checked in quite late, and the staff were waiting for me upon my arrival. The staff were always friendly; with a smile and a hello. The breakfast was good - fruit and toast and a cooked breakfast if you wanted it. My room was quite large, for a single, perhaps because I was staying for a week. It was clean and comfortable. Every morning, at about 7am, I was woken by the bells at the temple just down the road, but I liked this, as it saved me from waking to an awful alarm clock. The chairs in the lobby are awesome, and the location of the hotel is great - 5 minutes from the MRT and from Chinatown. The only complaint I have about my stay is that my room was right in front of the lift, and quite often I could hear people talking out there. Overall, I enjoyed my stay very much, and happily recommend this quirky and cute hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your time”
Reviews.Author: foreignjournalist
Reviews.Content: Be very wary of this place. We stayed two nights and it was pretty unpleasant. The inroom broadband internet didn't work hotel-wise and despite many guests loudly complaining about it, hotel management replied with a variation of 1)it must be your computer's settings aka not our fault 2)the service is often down (in 'wired' Singapore? dont think so) and 3) its free, so why are you complaining? The website advertised $S170 rates, inc taxes, for a double turn out to be $S230+ when checking out. If those rates have lured you here, read very carefully the return email from the hotel which has an entirely different, higher number on it, the one they hold you to when you check out. And the rooms are minute. One plus, its restaurant Ember is very good. Eat there but suggest staying elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but small”
Reviews.Author: sincewednesday
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 1929 is a small, stylish hotel. The rooms are sparsely decorated. The standard room is small. The free minibar can literally hold only a bottle of water and a can of cola. The desk is a ledge, but to use the free wired internet, it was more comfortable to sit on the foot of the bed than squeeze into the chair in front of it. (I am a small person, too.) There is minimal storage, although the under-bed drawer was difficult to use as it rolls when opening or closing it, and the drawer would tip when opened due to the weight of items in it. A small safe was also inside the drawer. The included breakfast is mostly western -- you are served a plate of eggs, chicken sausage, bacon, potatoes, and baked beans, and can select from a buffet of croissants, toast, and fresh fruit. There was also a rice porridge or noodle dish. A big automatic espresso machine made coffee, espresso, cappuccino, and the like. Due to their exterior renovation work (as of March 2008), there is currently scaffolding and a sheeting covering their exterior, which also means that you can't open the windows or access the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “small but good”
Reviews.Author: JHCLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its rooms are small (as they say it is) but its a good stay too. The rooms are funky and provided you are not claustrophobic they fit you and your possessions fine. the hotel is in a good location and staff are friendly. I'd recommend it to anyone passing through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I was prepared for 'small,' but...”
Reviews.Author: jcn2045
Reviews.Content: The reviews are pretty accurate. I was stopping over for a day before flying back to the US, and only wanted a simple room. I was ready for a small room, but this was beyond that. Closets are bigger. It was fairly noisy, especially the A/C. I can't imagine being in that room with a second person, especially with the tiny glassed in toilet/shower (No, not a toilet in the same room as the shower -- a toliet under the shower head in a glass box about 2ft in length and width. At least the ceilings are a normal height). Still, free internet and a small fridge in a nice section of the city. 5 minutes from the MRT and an adequate hawker stand. Clean room, OK breakfast (but free, so I can't complain). Polite people at the desk. Overall, it's possible to spend a little more for a lot better room and location, but if you plan on only dropping in to sleep it's certainly clean and cheaper than most everything else (especially now).

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for a short business trip”
Reviews.Author: ervingara
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here in January 2008, due to unavailability of rooms elsewhere. I had a small room on the 4th floor, with no windows but a couple of skylights. What the others say is true....it's small, the desk is a piece of wood coming out of the wall. If you have a lot of stuff, it's probably not for you. There were some noteworthy benefits: 1. Free water & soft drinks. 2. Free broadband. 3. Excellent breakfast 4. Rooms without windows are incredibly quiet! 5. No bugs. 6. No mildew smell so common elsewhere in Singapore 7. Friendly staff with good service. If you're out every day and spend little time in the room, Hotel 1929 will be just fine. I would stay at Hotel 1929 again if on my own, but I would not recommend this type of small room for more than one person. The suites looked pretty nice though!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! The rooms and the hotel has character!”
Reviews.Author: brookeinnsw
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel advertises the rooms are small, so no surprises there. On arrival the staff are friendly and will answer any questions you have. Although small, the rooms pack a fair amount of punch - they have everything you need! They offer free water and coke a cola, as well as tea and coffee. The beds are extreemly comfortable and the furnishings are wonderful. I rate this hotel and its staff highly - I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1929 Worst boutique hotel of the world”
Reviews.Author: Phileric
Reviews.Content: I write this review from what the hotel called a "SUITE" ,beleive the hotel management doesn't know what is a suite even in a design boutique hotel.Not enough space to store 2 medium suitcases, queen bed put against a wall with just a small space between it and the shower/toilet unit but a small empty fridge at the oposite ( we were supposed to have complementary drink inside we just found water!). I know the room are quite tiny in this hotel but here is very ridiculous to propose some suite.Even the bed sheet are not very clean, dark stains on it....Only to small towel for a double room! Ok we have very nice bathroom outside on the small terrace but surrounded by housing building ! The lady at the front office was very kind but she seems to be alone in the hotel, we had asked for 2 diet coke and never get them ! We are travelling a lot arround the world and stay only in small boutique hotel and would say this one is the worst. The idea was interresting but the realization did not followed , the owner should visit some boutique hotel elsewhere to know exactly what it looks like ( room design and staff service)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, some small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RickNet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and had a small room in the hotel with only a skylight (I think every room is different). Everything is compact in the hotel. Lack of privacy from the glass bathroom and lack of floor space means the room I was in was only good for one. Althougth compact it had everything I needed including free boradband which was great for my work. Breakfast was a basic buffet and some people who are used to larger hotels might think the range is too small. Air conditioning in the hotel is via 'split systems' and each room has its own unit. My room was on the top floor and the temp did not drop below 24c overnight. I would hope that this has been fixed by now. Great location and staff who are all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, but everything you need”
Reviews.Author: CanberraLad
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, very well located in China Town and close to excellent hawker market and MTR. Very small room (literally could not swing a cat - I tried using my towel as a stand-in feline), but everything you need and very clean. Good breakfast was included in my price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyTraveler73
Reviews.Content: Overall not a bad option for the money. Room was small but smartly appointed and clean. Hot water did run out quickly, though. Good location close to MRT (public transportation) and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: LL2007
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Hotel 1929 was disappointing to the extent i feel compelled to share our experience with other travelers who may also find this hotel highly recommended via travel guides. From a design perspective, the proprietors did the best with what they had - the result being a cute enough hotel that photographs well. The thing that is not immediately evident however, is that the rooms are TINY - OK if you are alone, but not for a couple. To add to that, the "shower/toilet" is a glass box 6" from the bed, so there is nothing even close to privacy - and you need to shower above the toilet (the bathroom was also moldy). The biggest problem however was the noise - the walls are not insulated, and there was a 1" gap at the bottom of the door, making everyone's everything extremely audible at all hours of the day and night. The price tag for the stay here was way too high for what amounts to a glorified hostel. Find something else.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Lightandbubbly2001
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for several days this July (July 9-12) since it was near the Singapore General Hospital where I had my checkup. There had been varying reviews to this hotel and I think it is because we have our own expectations and opinions. My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel 1929. I called in to book our reservation to this hotel. The one who answered my queries and booking was very warm and courteous. This was unlike a staff of another hotel nearby who was very rude when I inquired over the phone. My reservation conservation came immediately and there was daily email from the staff with regards to our booking. We arrived on a midnight so we requested for a limousine service. Unfortunately the limousine driver missed us because our flight was delayed and there was a long queue at the immigration. The staff were very accomodating in resolving this problem. Our room was small by standards but it was cozy. There is a water heater for bath, a small ref, internet connection, television, hairdryer, water heater, aircondition. Sheets were changed daily. There was a welcome note and chocolates from the General Manager and the Asst Manager for Concierge. We were able to sleep soundly, not distrurbed by the noise outside - this despite our room location (at the street corner). Staff was very warm and greeted us always with a smile, all with sunny personality. Thank you for your warm hospitality: to Ms Selria (whom I didnt get to meet personally - probably next time), Ms Angelia (Concierge), Winnie (Restaurant), Zawiyah, Hazley, Satinah, Amin (all from front desk), Ruen and Rashid (housekeeping, second floor). And of course, there was Bob, the bear. Hotel 1929 is our home away from home. It is walking distance to most stores in Chinatown like, to the famous Tiong Shan porridge restaurant, souvenir shops, a five minute walk to Outram Park MRT Station, Singapore General Hospital. Although it is a boutique hotel, you will have that sense of being brought back into time to the old Singapore, sans the high rise buildings... Hoping to visit you again soon

Reviews.Title: “tiny, noisy and humid”
Reviews.Author: missou
Reviews.Content: air conditioning didn't work properly, windows didn't close properly (had mosquitos coming in and with Singapore's dengue fever problem I figured that was quite a big deal), room was tiny and cramped (far too small for 2 adults), tiny bathroom, couldn't sleep because of all the road traffic outside and terrible noise isolation, rude staff (gave me attitude when I told them how disappointed I was. they claimed I got a 'very good' price and could not expect to get a better room). breakfast was shabby. never again.

Reviews.Title: “Bijou hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenaSwindonUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on the first leg of our honeymoon. The rooms were small but comfortable and the staff were lovely including 'Bob' the bear on the chair in reception! and very helpful. The hotel is very conveniently located for Chinatown and MRT to take you anywhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: RonS75
Reviews.Content: Lonely Planet gave a strong recommendation on this hotel so we decided to go for it and booked directly via the hotels own webpage. Arriving at the hotel we had a friendly check in and were guided to the room. The rooms are very small but are decorated with style. A bit dissapointing is the bathroom, which is not more then a large shower with a toilet inside. In general we liked the hotel, the breakfast and the location next to China town.

Reviews.Title: “Snug but comfy”
Reviews.Author: USExpat_in_Asia
Reviews.Content: I lived in Singapore for several years and would stay at Hotel 1929 for in-country get-aways. The staff are very responsive (which is rare in Singapore, which is just beginning to address customer satisfaction) and they remember the faces of the people who have stayed at the hotel previously. Breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel (Ember) lacks variety, but any visit to Singapore should include a visit to one of Singapore's food centres to experience hawker-style cuisine. Rooms are small but cozy. Luggage can be stored under the bed or in the drawers at the foot of the bed (which include small room safe). The toilet in the shower issue that others have commented upon is common in some parts of Asia (and some parts of Europe!) so just make sure that that toilet paper is covered and don't be afraid to ask the staff for extra towels!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice”
Reviews.Author: AsianGeekette
Reviews.Content: First stay: May 29 - June 1, 2006 I first stayed here last year because of budgetary constraints (company budget for my trip) and because it was quite near the office (5 minutes by cab). I liked the funky furniture and bedcover. I was prepared to stay in a small room since I'm used to small rooms. I had to use my laptop when I'm on the bed since the desk is quite small for the laptop. The plus thing here is the free internet access. What I didn't like was the sour-faced auntie who confronted me on my last day. There was a problem with the air conditioner on my last night and when I asked the front desk staff to check it, she said there's something wrong with it. So she upgraded me at no extra cost to their deluxe double room (which was a bit larger than the superior single room). The next day when I was about to check-out, the auntie (cleaning lady) told me that there's nothing wrong with their air conditioner since she checks it every morning. She told me that I didn't press the remote control hard enough. But I just shrugged it off and told her that even the front desk staff member can't get it to work. Second stay: September 10-16, 2006 The next time I was in Singapore, I stayed again in this hotel since the local Singaporean office can't book me in a hotel. I had to find my own hotel and it has to be within the budget set by the office. At that time, it was difficult trying to get rooms so I just made a reservation at Hotel 1929. It's actually easier to call them instead of using their website. This time, I stayed in a superior double room. It has a larger bed than the single superior room. Generally, it seems as if the rooms are really a bit cramped. You have the toilet in the shower area. You don't have a separate cabinet. Just a place to hang your clothes and a drawer beneath the bed to keep your place. Though the restaurant has gotten much reviews, the breakfast buffet choices are limited. You're given a plate of 2 small bacon, 2 eggs, a small serving of potatoes and a small serving of canned baked beans. You cholesterol level will go up if you keep eating 2 eggs everyday of your stay there. Better just eat the oatmeal and the yoghurt they have there. You should stay here if you don't mind small living space (like you're out all day working or touring), not choosy with breakfast buffet (there are other places to eat around Chinatown), don't mind the occasional mold in the shower room, need fast and free internet access AND can sleep despite some noise.

Reviews.Title: “truly awful”
Reviews.Author: Frottager
Reviews.Content: Showering while standing in the toilet is a joke, and remember to be in and out fast, they warn you at check-in that "...the water takes ages to heat up and doesn't last long". The room's are very noisy, both with traffic and other guests. No wardrobes, tiny TV's and 1-can fridges must make this one of the most expensive cupboards in the world. The bed's a single, and makes a lot of noise when you move, and the aircon blows directly in your face while you sleep (to be honest, the room's so small it has no-where else to point). I saw this described as "3 star" which is totally misleading, and to see a hotels reviews (and a large part of it's website) based on the chairs in the lobby, show's how little else it has to offer. I checked out 3 days early (was booked by my company for 4 days) and told them I'd rather sleep in the office. Quirky, funky and quiant it might be, comfortable, practical, funcional and fun it definately is not.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Where else do you put the toliet but in the shower”
Reviews.Author: sydneyforest
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and very psychedic - all different types of chairs in reception area and pictures of chairs in the lift - so far so good. I stayed in a single room. And then you get to the room. 1. Single bed (all you can fit in the room anyway) 2. No closet - there is a single bar hanging from the wall with three clothes hangers that's all 3. As indicated above, the toilet is in the shower 4. Water heater has to be turned on and after leaving it on all night I managed to get about three mins shower 5. Hardly any space to store luggage 6. Desk just a bit bigger than a laptop (free internet access though) 7. Noisy corridors being wood and noisy air con units outside so very little sleep

Reviews.Title: “Can't Meet Its Obligations”
Reviews.Author: Msg_Singaporean
Reviews.Content: I am a Singaporean. I made reservations for 4 guests (2 rooms) at Hotel 1929, who arrived in Singapore on 7 Nov early morning. Reservation was confirmed directly to me by the hotel reservation staff, however when my guests arrived at the hotel, they were told that they is only 1 ROOM left !! I am very unsatisfied and fuming mad at the way the hotel staff handled the matter. As the rooms were not easily available during the past 1 week, we could only find 2 rooms at Robinson Hotel on Balestier Road (which is not convenient at all) for 2 nights. Thereafter, we had to search high & low for accommodation. Hotel 1929 didn't even offer to arrange transportation to send my 4 guests to the alternative accommodation. The guests took a cab to Robinson Hotel. One couple was here for honeymoon. They enjoyed themselves in Maldives and was throwm from heaven to hell !. I felt so sorry to my guests. So whoever wants to stay at this hotel (they have a newly opened hotel known as New Majestic Hotel), be prepared to be left in the lurch and take the risks of having to stay out on the street if you do not have any friends in Singapore. I hope this unhappy incident to happen to another innocent soul because I would be equally mad if such unhappy incident happen to me in a foreign land. This was reflected to the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) who only acts as a "postbox" to deliver my message to Hotel 1929. The STB is able to do nothing - so don't expect much ! Two compliments to Summer View Hotel. Even though Summer View is probably a 3 star hotel, I find that their service is very good :- (i) the staff offer to pack breakfast for my guests who need to leave the hotel at 5.30am to catch their flight. This is a very kind gesture of them. (ii) The uncle/security guard (I think he is in his 60s) who is working at the carpark behind the hotel highlighted to us that the exit door to the carpark would be shut after 11pm, so we had to leave from the front door. Wonderful service - much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: blackpushkin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a cool/hip place in Singapore. It offers great value for money and is close to all attractions in China Town. The only downside is that the rooms are very small, but hey one doesn't go to Singapore to spend time in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Too loud for a decent night of sleep.”
Reviews.Author: shioka
Reviews.Content: The main complaint is how noisy it was at night. I got the side facing the road. The hotel is close to some eating places that open till midnight and I could hear people talking and other noises that sound like a compressor or perhaps just the kitchen till midnight, then, those noises went away, only to be replaced by what seemingly sound like BIG trucks but are simply cabs looking for potentially customers every 3-5 mins. They get really loud. I had a sleepless night, but luckily got out at 4am the second night to catch a flight. The door that opens out to the balcony look a little old and definitely does no help in keeping the noise out. For the same price, you can find a much better hotel elsewhere, one on a high floor please. Also the restaurant was being renovated at that time and I was only notifed when I checked in. Breakfast which consisted of some unappetizing sausage and eggs was instead served in a small plastic container. I wasn't too happy with this.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: DissatisfiedCustomer
Reviews.Content: Same problems as everyone else: I booked the smallest room they had and that room was so ridiculously tiny that I could easily get rooms that are double or triple that size for the same price elsewhere in Singapore. You do shower standing right next to the toilet and the water leaks out of the door into your room. The resulting puddle was 1 step away from my bed. The garbage truck arrived early in the morning and there was no soundproofing. Breakfast was slow, cold and sad - the coffee was worse than Nescafe instant coffee. The chairs are beautiful, as is the lobby but the rooms made me feel too claustrophobic. There are many other much better alternatives in Singapore. I only planned to stay one night, but it wasn't a great night. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dk_worldwide
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the Hotel 1929 online me and my boyfriend were prepared for a very small room. But we never expected SUCH a small room... Although the room was lovingly decorated we were not able to open our suitcases and the very spare storage area was just enough to deposit our mobiles and some sunglasses. The bed was big enough, the matress hard enough and the AC fully adjustable to our wishes. Within five minutes we could reach nice little bars and great food was just around the corner as well: The famous Maxwell Hawker Centre is close by. The staff was very helpful and nice and free soft drinks were provided in the room. So far so good. Upon arrival I asked myself why there was a tiny musical clock in the room. Soon I found out: One corner of our already very small room was designated as "bathroom" meaning that behind a glass wall there was a shower and toilet. The glass wall was partly frosted; just enough to allow a minimum of sanitary privacy. But no way to block any sounds... Well, time for the musical clock! Unfortunately the breakfast was a joke. Our eggs came along with some baked beans, greasy bacon and rubberlike potato wedges, the "buffet" consisted only of prepacked jam and butter plus toast. My advice for future travellers: Better skip the breakfast and dig into some delicious noodle soup in one of the Chinese restaurants around the corner. In conclusion I must admit that the Hotel 1929 looks better than it feels. Sure, the design is awesome and very cool. But staying in this hotel is not the great experience we were looking forward to. Better go there for a dinner and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel.”
Reviews.Author: docrok
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as "neutral" but I'm a sucker for the design of the place. Very hip-retro-funky style but the standard rooms are pretty tight. I stayed there awhile back but have seen it in a number of travel mags since. My taxi driver said that we were in the red light district, but it sure didn't seem like it. Within walking distance (half a mile or so) to the train and Chinatown, so there's no shortage of access to the rest of the Singapore. Just be ready to squeeze into a small room. Mine had a single twin bed and the toilet was in the shower which took some getting used to. If you're going to spend a lot of time in the room then maybe not for you, but if you want to stay at a cool little hotel for a night or two, this is a pretty neat place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “funky 1929”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1929 is a very nice boutique hotel in a nice area of Sigapore city. I had a superior room, which is a bit bigger than standards (I've seen standards when housekeeping was cleaning them, and they are a bit small actually), very colourful. The shower with transparent glass in the room is beautiful. The staff is very kind and there's a jacuzzi on a terrace that everyone can use. It's a place that never makes feel you alone and it's a place that gives you joy in a city so boring and SO without soul. francesco

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Marms&Elms
Reviews.Content: I was eager to try this hotel after hearing so much about it. The overall experience was, however, very disappointing. As others have pointed out, the rooms were exceptionally small. I was a single traveller and upgraded myself to a double room after the first night in the single which was claustrophobic. The hotel should have been designed with fewer rooms; the bigger rooms would have been more inviting to visitors, and also promote return visits. There was also considerable sounds from the air-conditioning units outside the room and even in my new room on the top floor the wall insulation from the corridor was very poor. On the positives, the hotel is situated in a unique area of the city with a delightful old-style coffee shop next door serving excellent coffee and soft boiled eggs and kaya toast. The hotel's restaurant is also excellent. I would return for this, but not for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Something Different”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 1929 from March 17-20 in a Deluxe Room, and had a very good experience. Unlike many hotels, many 'extras' were included in the cost of my room--that means no additional charge for broadband internet, soft drinks and water in my fridge, and breakfast. The staff was very friendly and attentive, and genuinely wanted to make my stay an enjoyable one. Try to get a reservation at Ember, the restaurant next door--amazing! The downsides--I'd say my room was rather small, but also well designed, so that I never felt cramped. It's worth upgrading--I'd say they're 20% larger than the standard rooms. My only other gripe was that the room wasn't very soundproofed--I could hear trucks driving by at all hours, and people entering their rooms. I wanted some different than the generic chains seen throughout Singapore--and got it! It was a fun place to stay, with a GREAT location, and good service. However, if you're looking for the usual perks of a major chain--large rooms, a gym, quiet, etc., then you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young people on a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Mazworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Yes the rooms are very very small. But they are new, modern, quirky, comfortable and clean. The jacuzzi was nice and we sat there everyday for a brief moment. Staff were flexible and the lady at breakfast was amazing- She remembered how everyone likes their eggs. We liked this place and would go back there but ask for a larger room. Definitly worth a try if you are young, travelling light and like attention to detail and contemporary design.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 1929
HotelInfo.Address: 50 Keong Saik Road, Singapore 089154, Singapore
